result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Blackburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  If defendant has previously provided a DNA sample, he does not need to provide another sample.  The costs are to be paid as follows :  $221.50 due February 2, 2017 with the balance due March 2, 2017.

The jail sentence shall begin no later than March 2, 2017 at 4:30 pm.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew S. Blackburn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Matthew S. Blackburn in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 5 days county jail with huber and good time.   Costs are to be paid as follows 1/2 due today and balance March 2, 2017.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 2, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Matthew S. Blackburn in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  - rt
